result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor P Wells was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Partial payment plan:  $50.00 per month.  5 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevor P Wells

from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in compliance with agency requirements.

Defendant Trevor P Wells in court with attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel.  In treatment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial conference at 10-08-2015 03:15 pm.
Status conference at 11-10-2015 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Trevor P Wells in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Trevor P Wells in custody. Antoinette Rich and Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
